title: World War I
aliases: The War To End All Wars
description: Global conflict centered in Europe that introduced industrial-scale warfare and reshaped empires, borders, and international diplomacy.

title: World War II
description: Worldwide war involving the Axis and Allies that resulted in massive casualties, the Holocaust, atomic bombings, and the onset of the Cold War.

title: French Revolution
description: Radical social and political upheaval that ended the Bourbon monarchy, advanced republicanism, and reshaped European politics.

title: The Cold War
description: Geopolitical rivalry between the United States and the Soviet Union marked by ideological conflict, nuclear arms race, and proxy wars.

title: The Industrial Revolution
description: Transition to mechanized manufacturing and new energy sources, dramatically increasing productivity and transforming societies.

title: The American Revolution
description: Colonial revolt against British rule leading to U.S. independence and the creation of a constitutional republic.

title: Meiji Restoration
description: Political revolution that restored imperial rule in Japan and accelerated rapid modernization, industrialization, and Western-style reforms, transforming Japan into a major world power.

title: World War II — European Theater
description: European campaigns of WWII including Blitzkrieg, the Eastern Front, D-Day, and the fall of Berlin, culminating in Germany’s surrender.

title: World War II — Pacific Theater
description: Pacific and Asian fronts of WWII from Pearl Harbor through island-hopping campaigns, Midway, and atomic bombings, ending with Japan’s surrender.
